articles.title: Trump's Failed Blog Proves He Was Just Howling Into the Void
articles.description: Without the algorithmic boosts of Twitter and Facebook, there are few “active” internet users to be found.
articles.content: Former president and former king of social media Donald Trump decided this week to shut down his month-old blog, due to abysmal readership. According to an analysis by TheWashington Post, Twitter and… [+4657 chars]

articles.author: Jennifer Ouellette, Ars Technica
articles.title: A New Type of Supernova Unlocks Old Stellar Mysteries
articles.description: The discovery of a rare “electron-capture” supernova provides crucial insight for understanding the Crab Nebula.
articles.content: Around July 4, 1054, Chinese astronomers recorded a "guest star" that shone so brightly, it was visible in broad daylight for 23 days. The remnants of that long-ago supernova now form the Crab Nebula… [+4549 chars]

articles.title: French Spyware Executives Are Indicted for Aiding Torture
articles.description: The managers are accused of selling tech to Libya and Egypt that was used to to identify activists, read private messages, and kidnap, torture, or kill them.
articles.content: Earlier this week, French authorities indicted four former executives of the surveillance firm Nexa Technologies, formerly called Amesys, for complicity in torture and war crimes. Between 2007 and 20… [+4316 chars]

articles.title: The Pandemic Put an End to Rush Hour. What Happens Now?
articles.description: Remote work generally reduces driving. But the travel behavior of telecommuters isn’t as straightforward as it might seem.
